{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3649928,"name":"Cooper Surma","username":"CooperSurma","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/coopersurma/{size}/232004_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-10T02:27:27.513Z","cooked":"

The recent addition of CAM studios to Onshape Education Enterprise has gotten our team thinking about if it’s worth the money. I’m curious to hear from those who have decided to use it for FRC about what their experience has been like and if they would recommend it to other teams.

  1. What drove the decision to pay for EDU Enterprise?

  2. What features have been the most helpful for running an FRC team (and which ones haven’t)?

  3. What unique challenges and considerations have come from using an enterprise as opposed to a standard team/classroom?

  4. Would you recommend EDU Enterprise to other teams?

  5. (If you are able to say) How much are you paying for EDU Enterprise? Numbers I’ve found online seem to say it’s around $3500 per year but I’m wondering if the going rate is any different for FRC teams since there isn’t any fixed price from what I can see.

With CAM coming to EDU ENTs first, I thought this would eventually pop up.

As far as I’m aware, there are no teams paying for an enterprise specifically for team usage. There are many teams that work inside of an enterprise purchased by the school for classroom use and some other special cases.

The Educator plan has the same features that are relevant to teams. Features like Analytics, SSO, granular global permissions, and enterprise-wide app management are really helpful for school implementations, but not something teams are concerned with.

In general, FRC is expensive, and Onshape is not interested in asking teams to pay for our software. Onshape leadership talked with many teams at Champs this year and totally understands how large the demand for CAM is. Trust me, we’re working on it
